name: Aesopica - The Wizard - A return home and back to self

metadata.name: The Wizard - A return home and back to self
metadata.description:
The moral lesson of the fable is that one should be careful what they wish for, as the things they desire may not bring them happiness. 

The fable highlights the importance of appreciating what we have and being content with our current situation, rather than always seeking something new or different.    
 



There once was a wizard who lived,  
In a grand castle, his magic thrived,  
Through the land, his powers were known,  
For those in need, he would atone.

One day, while the wizard was out,  
Thieves broke in without a doubt,  
They took all his belongings and fled,  
Leaving the wizard feeling full of dread.

The wizard tried to catch the thieves,  
But alas, he couldn't help but grieve,  
He realized that he had been wrong,  
To focus on possessions for so long.

The wizard left his castle and went away,  
Using his magic to help each day,  
He helped heal the sick, protect the weak,  
And fight for justice for those who couldn't speak.

As the wizard traveled from town to town,  
His reputation spread and grew renowned,  
For his selflessness and true compassion,  
He became a legend throughout the nation.

The wizard lived out the rest of his days,  
Using his powers in myriad ways,  
He learned that helping others was his call,  
His true purpose is to serve and help all.

Collection: Aesopica by Storytime DAO
